channel.title: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!
channel.description:
I think we should just ban members that post viruses and other crap because as a leecher myself I would like to be able to leech a server in peace without having a pro hacker make me pay for his amazing source by keylogging and taking the money from paypal or taking my runescape account alongside stealing other information.
Just making it a safer place :)

item.title: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

If someone is posting malicious content beyond a reasonable doubt, they should be banned permanently from the sight. This is in the recommended guidelines for moderators with ban powers. Nevertheless, there are multiple levels of banning. If someone posts 2-3 topics with potentially malicious content, I usually will mute them at 100% and see if they come back in 2 weeks to do it again. If they do, they will be banned completely from the site. This isn’t the required behavior of the moderators, but it is what I do personally. Do what you see fit, as long as the member does not have access here anymore. It’s pretty obvious that if a member is trying to hurt other members, they shouldn’t be here anymore. I see no reason not to ban them from this site.

This is what we have always done and it’s what we’ll continue to do.

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!

item.title: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

People are banned for posting viruses and the link will be removed, if it is not message the mods until you get a reply and if not message the admins until you get reply.

@Si Force, people should be banned on sight for posting viruses. If it turns out that their account is compromised then they can sort it out via appeal.

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I was only asking because there have been servers attacking eachother in the past so why wouldn’t they go to the length of infecting files on the rival servers’ websrver?

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!

item.title: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:17, topic:519044”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=637498.msg4296949#msg4296949 date=1368386586]

What’d happen if someone hotlinked to a clean file and then the file was changed on the webserver to be malicious, with nothing to do with the user?

Should of uploaded somewhere safer!

*have

http://www.virusbtn.com/news/2011/09_27.xml
There are no “safe” sites, but note how I said “hotlinked” which means that the user would have said “here’s the download link to SQL” rather than “I uploaded SQL here”

I don’t see it happening often, are you planning on posting a virus and using this as your excuse?
[/quote]

Yep, I’d like to infect members of a community I’ve been a part of for many years…[/quote]

Sounds legit

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

If I had a global power I personally would ban anyone posting malicious files or programs regardless of who they were. That well known user can appeal the ban through the IRC or something similar with proof of their account being compromised or whatever their excuse is. Although Si is correct, it is down to the moderator handling it.

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!

item.title: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:10, topic:519044”]Does it show banned status lol?

I think you should just get banned even if hes well known (thinking hes popular). Providing +70 or +100 was any concern to them as they would still have a possibility of doing it again.[/quote]

If there are multiple occurrences then they’ll be banned without doubt. And nope, only moderators can see which member is banned.

Read full topic

item.source: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!

item.title: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:519044”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=637498.msg4296866#msg4296866 date=1368379284]
Bloody 4th link in download section -.-"

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

(read comments)
[/quote]That would probably be because sectional moderators cannot ban and Si Force didn’t see/check the reply after he asked for evidence.

However, I do remember that when I was mod people were +100’ing or +70’ing people that posted viruses instead of instantly banning. Unless it was an account made to post the thread, or they spammed it, etc.[/quote]

Yeah, this. I banned him a while ago. It depends on the situation really, I’d +70 a member that is well-known and usually doesn’t act in that way(if there’s a possibility that his account was compromised) however I would ban a member that is new to the forums and only joined with malicious intent.

I disagree with you if you think that every member should be banned for posting malicious content, it is dependent on the situation and the moderators discretion.

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - COMPLETE] Ban members who post viruses!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:4, topic:519044”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=637498.msg4296809#msg4296809 date=1368368196]
Anyone who does post malware is generally banned if the topic is reported and there’s enough proof to show that it was malicious.
[/quote]

Users generally post virus scans in post and all that ever happens is thread get closed? It does not seem as if anything happens to the original poster.[/quote]
If you provide examples then it’ll be sorted out. Another problem is someone will see that and not report it, if you don’t report it we more than likely won’t see it and ultimately nothing will be done.

Read full topic

Because right now everyone who posts them is banned for life. Mods are not doing their job if they are just locking it.
